node.title: Focus on Politics: Will traffic lights see Covid hitting the gas?
node.description: Podcast - "If we don't all rush back out to try and get back to that level 1 life then the system will work better". This week, we put on the brakes and look at what the traffic light system means forâ€¦ Audio
node.content:
["On 23 March last year life changed forever with\u00a0the pandemic wreaking global devastation\u00a0but after nearly two years of alert levels and lockdowns, New Zealanders will have to get used to a new kind of response that includes Covid-19 actively circulating in the community.", "Replacing the alert levels will be a traffic light system - green, orange and red.", "", "
\nPhoto: RNZ / Vinay Ranchhod\n
", "Auckland may move to the new system - into red - ahead of the rest of the country once its three DHBs hit 90 percent of the population double vaccinated. Everywhere else is expected to move together when all DHBs reach\u00a0that target.", "Covid-19 modeller Shaun Hendy says the system means tolerating some Covid-19 in the community, and he\u00a0expects we'll remain in the red for much of next year.\u00a0", "\"We might find ourselves spending, you know, three quarters of next year in the Red, and maybe a quarter in Green or Orange. That's given our current vaccine targets which is 90 percent of the over-12s.\u00a0If we move on and do go on to vaccinate the\u00a05-11 year olds\u00a0\u2026 then that might shift us for example to spending 50 percent of our time in the red traffic light zone, with less impact on schooling.\"", "He says the kind of outbreak seen in Victoria or New South Wales with thousands of new cases a day is unlikely, but 400 to 500 new daily cases would put real strain on the healthcare system.\u00a0", "\"I think even the coming peak between 200 to 300 cases per day that we think is most likely will put strain on the system. It\u2019ll certainly fill up the capacity we have within Auckland to deal with Covid.\"\u00a0", "He says retailers will play a big role\u00a0with just a few rule-breakers being enough to lead to a bigger outbreak, and the public will also need to toe the line.\u00a0", "Read more:\u00a0", "The government's come under heavy criticism for mishandling the vaccination rollout for M\u0101ori too,\u00a0with rates still lagging behind other New Zealanders. There are grave concerns about the health and social consequences\u00a0of M\u0101ori being less highly vaccinated, as well as\u00a0potential backlash from those angered by feeling they've been held up.", "Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says the government wants no one left behind, but\u00a0it begs the question:\u00a0what will the government do if some DHBs are stuck below the 90 percent target.\u00a0", "Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says the 29 November Cabinet meeting will be a crunch point for deciding on overall rates and next steps.\u00a0", "\"I don't want to get ahead of that Cabinet conversation ... but we've made a commitment not to leave people behind. That doesn't mean that if people choose to be left behind that we're gonna hold everybody else up because of the choice that they make.\"", "Under the traffic light system, a vaccine certificate will be needed to do all sorts of things - going to bars, restaurants, concerts, travel - and Hipkins says people need to prepare now by setting up their 'My Covid Record'.\u00a0", "And as\u00a0the new system nears, Prof Hendy says it's imperative that the system remain flexible enough to change.\u00a0", "\"We\u2019ve\u00a0got\u00a0to\u00a0be clear that we haven\u2019t\u00a0tried to do this before. This is new ...\u00a0while this system, I think, is a reasonable first attempt at what we might need to manage things\u00a0we're\u00a0gonna\u00a0need to innovate, we're\u00a0gonna\u00a0need to try new things,\u00a0we're\u00a0gonna\u00a0need to bring new tools to bear over the coming year.\"\u00a0", "Listen free to\u00a0Focus on Politics\u00a0on\u00a0Apple Podcasts, on\u00a0\u00a0Spotify, on\u00a0iHeart Radio\u00a0or wherever you get your podcasts.\u00a0"]
